item.description:
At last month’s CT Health Foodies night, nutritionist Maribeth Abrams gave a talk about how sugar cravings make us feel tired and cranky and can eventually develop into Type II diabetes. She talked about how uncontrollable cravings and mood swings vanish once you adopt a high-fiber diet consisting of vegetables, beans, and whole grains.

Energy is high, and we feel calm, happy, and strong. According to Maribeth, healthy eating is *not* about deprivation – it is about bliss!

Eliminating an addiction to sugar, chips, or white flour can be challenging, because these foods are lurking everywhere. To provide support, holistic health coach Amy LaBossiere returns to CT Health Foodies to facilitate a discussion on how to break the cycle of sugar cravings and transition to a healthier diet.

During a delicious potluck dinner, we’ll share our collective battles with sugar addiction, discuss where sugar commonly hides in food, and implement strategies to disconnect the addiction.

Amy LaBossiere is Partner and Executive Director of Holistic Health for Still Waters retreat center and a holistic health counselor to individuals and groups. She is also a mixed media artist. More info about Amy: http://innerlighthhc.com/about-1

***************************************

Please note that this month we are meeting on the third Tuesday -- Tuesday, October 16.  In November, we will resume meeting on the second Tuesday.

***************************************

This event is organized by CT Health Foodies, a supportive community for people interested in healthy eating. We are a diverse group. People follow all different types of diets: gluten-free, vegetarian, omnivore, raw food, Ayurvedic, Weston A. Price. We respect everyone's choices.

We organize monthly potluck dinners and talks usually on the second Tuesday of the month at ArtSpace in downtown Hartford.

***************************************

Schedule for the evening:
7:15 pm: Delicious Potluck Dinner begins.
7:45 - 9:00 pm: Discussion
9:00 pm - 9:30 on: Hanging out and cleaning up

About the potluck dinner:
-Many people have dietary restrictions. Please be mindful as you prepare your dish, and list the ingredients on a note card. Note cards will be available at the event.

-This a zero-waste event. Please bring your own plate and utensils.

***************************************

Donations between $2-$5 requested.
***************************************
FREE PARKING! In the back of the ArtSpace building. Ignore "Resident Parking Only" signs. Parking is allowed during this event. Enter through the back entrance by the murals.
***************************************
item.how_to_find_us: Enter through the back entrance by the murals. Walk down the long corridor. At the end of the corridor, on the right, you will see the room where we will be meeting.
item.name: How to Avoid the Sugar Stalker and Feel Invincible: Part II
